alert.note: Alert for Grand Isle (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 7:06AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy snow will impact portions of Clinton, southeastern Franklin, northwestern Essex and northwestern Grand Isle Counties through 745 AM EST... At 705 AM EST, heavy snow was reported along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Champlain to near Forked Lake Public Campground. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility less than a quarter mile, and snow accumulation 1 to 2 inches per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Plattsburgh, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Wilmington, Alburgh Village, Champlain, Clayburg, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Rouses Point, Alburgh, Isle La Motte and North Elba.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
